speaker: ナレーター
japanese: 何の事件も起こらないように思われたのですが
english: It seemed like nothing eventful would happen, but...

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: パンケーキ!
english: Pancakes!

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: 見ればわかるでしょ?これから焼くのよ
english: Can't you see? I'm about to cook them now.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: これから?
english: From now?

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: すぐできます、待ってなさい
english: They'll be ready soon, just wait.

speaker: ミー
japanese: ママ、パンケーキできた?
english: Mama, are the pancakes ready?

speaker: スノーク
japanese: なんだ、こんなもの!ダメだ、ダメだ!
english: What is this! No good, no good!

speaker: フローレン
japanese: やめて、お兄さん!大事な設計図でしょ?
english: Stop it, brother! That's an important blueprint, isn't it?

speaker: スノーク
japanese: ああ、失敗だ!僕には才能がないんだ!
english: Ah, it's a failure! I have no talent!

speaker: フローレン
japanese: お兄さんは前に、陸を走る船を作ったじゃない
english: But brother, you made a land-sailing ship before, didn't you?

speaker: スノーク
japanese: あんなもの!
english: That thing!

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 陸を走る船を作った人なら、空飛ぶ船だって作れるわ
english: If you can make a ship that runs on land, you can make a flying ship too.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: もっと自信を持って、お兄さん
english: Have more confidence, brother.

speaker: スノーク
japanese: 昨日の夜これを書いた時は自信満々だったんだ
english: I was full of confidence when I wrote this last night.

speaker: スノーク
japanese: ところが今日、もう一度設計図を見直してみると
english: But when I looked at the blueprint again today...

speaker: スノーク
japanese: ああ、これじゃ空を飛ぶわけはない
english: Ah, there's no way this will fly.

speaker: スノーク
japanese: 水の上だって進みやしない
english: It won't even move on water.

speaker: スノーク
japanese: 僕には、発明の才能なんてないんだ!
english: I don't have any talent for invention!

speaker: スノーク
japanese: ああ、ダメだ!もうダメだ!
english: Ah, it's no good! I'm done for!

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: さあ、できたわ
english: There, they're ready.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: ミーも食堂へ行きなさい
english: My, go to the dining room too.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: フローレンが来たわ
english: Floren has arrived.

speaker: ミー
japanese: 大丈夫、フローレンのことだもの
english: It's fine, it's Floren after all.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: フローレン泣いてた?
english: Was Floren crying?

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: 大丈夫、お兄さんも今に自信を取り戻すから
english: It's okay, her brother will regain his confidence soon.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: 物を新しく作り出す人は、時々そうなるらしいよ
english: People who create new things apparently go through this sometimes.

speaker: ミー
japanese: じゃあ、あなたのパパもそうなの?
english: Then does your Papa go through that too?

speaker: ミー
japanese: パパは小説を書いてるんでしょ?
english: Papa is writing a novel, right?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: パパはいつも自信満々だよ
english: Papa is always full of confidence.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: フローレン、パンケーキ食べる?
english: Floren, would you like some pancakes?

speaker: フローレン
japanese: ありがとう、ママ、いただきます
english: Thank you, Mama, I'll have some.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: ムーミン、パパを呼んでいらっしゃい
english: Moomin, go call Papa.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: 一休みしてもいい頃でしょ
english: It's about time for a break, isn't it?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: はい
english: Yes.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 何かあったの、フローレン?
english: Did something happen, Floren?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 朝になると太陽が東の空に昇った
english: When morning came, the sun rose in the eastern sky.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: そしてあたりが明るくなった
english: And the surroundings became bright.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: おい、パパ、お前さん、こんな当たり前のことを書いて
english: Hey Papa, you're writing such obvious things...

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: よく恥ずかしくないな
english: Aren't you embarrassed?
grammar: よく〜ない (how can you not)

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: ああ、私には文学的才能など全くないんだ
english: Ah, I have no literary talent whatsoever.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 想像力もない、感受性も衰えてる
english: I have no imagination, my sensitivity has declined.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: もう小説を書くのはやめるべきだ
english: I should stop writing novels.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: パパ
english: Papa.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 何か用かい?
english: Do you need something?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: あの、ママがおいしいパンケーキ作ったからどうぞって
english: Um, Mama made delicious pancakes and said to come eat.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: そう、でも今調子が出てきたところだから
english: I see, but I'm just getting into the groove now...

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 後でいただく
english: I'll eat later.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: まだ何かある?
english: Is there something else?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: いや、きっと僕の聞き違いだ
english: No, it must have been my imagination.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: ムーミン、やっぱり今食べる
english: Moomin, I'll eat now after all.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: おいしかった、ママ
english: That was delicious, Mama.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 僕遊びに行ってくるよ
english: I'm going out to play.

speaker: ミー
japanese: 私も行く
english: I'm going too.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: ダメ、フローレンと遊んでろよ
english: No, stay and play with Floren.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 僕はスナフキンとちょっと探検に行くんだ
english: I'm going on a little exploration with Snufkin.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: 遅かったな、今日は来ないのかと思った
english: You're late, I thought you weren't coming today.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 何してるの?
english: What are you doing?

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: 笹舟だよ、まるで本物の船のように流れていくぜ
english: It's a bamboo leaf boat. It flows along just like a real ship.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: あの調子じゃ、海まで流れ出て
english: At that rate, it might flow all the way to the sea...

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 知らない国まで行ってしまうぞ
english: It might even reach an unknown country.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: それで旅をするのも楽しそうだね
english: Traveling like that sounds fun.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: それじゃ、行こうか
english: Well then, shall we go?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: ミーやフローレンも一緒に行きたそうだったけど
english: My and Floren looked like they wanted to come too, but...

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 危ないからって置いてきた
english: I left them behind because it's dangerous.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: ミーは簡単には諦めないさ、ほら
english: My won't give up easily. Look.

speaker: ミー
japanese: おい、おい、私も一緒に行くって
english: Hey, hey, I'm coming along too!

speaker: フローレン
japanese: もちろん私たちもよ
english: Of course, us too.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: こんなとこ登るの?
english: We're climbing up here?

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: ムーミンが言った通り、みんなで登るのは無理だな
english: As Moomin said, it's impossible for everyone to climb.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 私とっても登れないわ
english: I definitely can't climb this.

speaker: ミー
japanese: 私は平気よ
english: I'm fine.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: ダメ、あなただって危ないわ、ミー
english: No, it's dangerous for you too, My.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: その通りさ、君たちはホラ穴の入り口で待ってろ
english: That's right, you all wait at the cave entrance.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: この先をもう少し行ったところだ、すぐ見つかるよ
english: It's just a little further ahead, you'll find it easily.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: あなたたちはそのホラ穴にこの上から入るのね?
english: You're entering the cave from up above?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: うん、縦穴を見つけたんだ
english: Yeah, we found a vertical shaft.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 本当にホラ穴につながってるのかしら?
english: I wonder if it really connects to the cave?

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: それを確かめてみるのさ
english: That's what we're going to find out.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: よし、行こうスナフキン
english: Alright, let's go, Snufkin.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: スニフはどうするの?
english: What about Sniff?

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 僕はあの、この二人と一緒にホラ穴の入り口で待ってるよ
english: I'll, um, wait at the cave entrance with these two.

speaker: ミー
japanese: 臆病なのね
english: You're such a coward.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 違う、この二人が何だか心細そうだから一緒に行ってやるんだ
english: No, these two look worried so I'm going with them.

speaker: ミー
japanese: 入ってみようか
english: Shall we go in?

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 何だか怖いわ
english: It's kind of scary.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: そうそう、何がいるか分からない
english: Yeah, we don't know what's in here.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 気をつけなくっちゃ
english: We have to be careful.

speaker: ミー
japanese: 馬鹿ね、ここには誰も住んでないのよ
english: Don't be silly, nobody lives here.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: だから怖いの
english: That's why it's scary.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: この辺がホラ穴の屋根になるんだね
english: This area must be the roof of the cave.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: で、縦穴はどこ?
english: So, where's the vertical shaft?

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: さあ、もう少しあっちの方だと思うけど
english: Well, I think it's a bit further that way.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 見て、こんな貝殻初めてだよ、ほら
english: Look, I've never seen a shell like this before!

speaker: フローレン
japanese: この辺にしては珍しい貝殻がたくさんあるね
english: There are a lot of rare shells around here.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: ほら、これも
english: Look, this one too.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: フローレン、ミーはどうしたの?
english: Floren, where did My go?

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 中に入っちゃったわ
english: She went inside.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: え?もう、だから退屈なら貝殻拾いでもすればいいのに
english: What? Geez, if she was bored she should have just picked shells.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: おい、ミー、戻ってこい、危ないぞ
english: Hey, My, come back, it's dangerous!

speaker: ミー
japanese: 臆病ね
english: Such a coward.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 何だと?勝手に黙って先に行ったくせに
english: What? You went ahead without saying anything!

speaker: ミー
japanese: 怖くないならここまで来ればいいんだわ
english: If you're not scared, just come here.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: よーし、待ってろ、今そこまで行ってやる
english: Alright, wait there, I'm coming!

speaker: スニフ
japanese: フローレンは一人でここで待ってるかい?
english: Floren, will you wait here alone?

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 何なら連れてってやってもいいぜ
english: If you want, I can take you with me.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 行く、私も
english: I'll go too.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: 暗くて危ないな
english: It's dark and dangerous.

speaker: フローレン
japanese: 手を繋ごうね
english: Let's hold hands.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: 引っ張ってみてくれ
english: Try pulling on it.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 大丈夫だね
english: It's safe, right?

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: どっちが先に降りる?
english: Who goes down first?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 僕
english: Me.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: それじゃ、気をつけて降りろよ
english: Then be careful going down.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: ゆっくり、ゆっくり、何も急ぐことはないさ
english: Slowly, slowly, there's no need to rush.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: 大丈夫か、ムーミン?
english: Are you okay, Moomin?

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: 大丈夫、ムーミン?
english: Are you okay, Moomin?

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 大丈夫、あ、ちょっとお尻をぶつけただけだ
english: I'm fine, I just bumped my bottom a little.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: ヘムレンさんがこんなところで昼寝していたんだ
english: Mr. Hemulen was taking a nap in a place like this.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: ヘムレンさん?
english: Mr. Hemulen?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: いや、驚いたのなんのって
english: Well, was I ever surprised!

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: でも、どうしてここにいたんです?
english: But why were you here?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: うん、実はこのところ私はすっかり落ち込んでるんだ
english: Well, actually I've been feeling really down lately.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: あの大事な切手のコレクションを盗まれたんですか?
english: Was your precious stamp collection stolen?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: あれだったら欠けた切手は一枚もない、完璧なコレクションだ
english: That collection is perfect, not a single stamp is missing.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: じゃあ、落ち込んでる理由は何です?
english: Then what's the reason you're feeling down?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: あの切手のコレクションのせいだ
english: It's because of that stamp collection.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: いや、私のコレクションは世界で一番だ
english: No, my collection is the best in the world.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: あれは私が長い間情熱を傾けて集めた素晴らしいコレクションだ
english: It's a wonderful collection I spent a long time passionately gathering.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 分からないな
english: I don't understand.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: 君たちみたいな若い人たちには分からないだろうな
english: Young people like you probably wouldn't understand.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: 私は一体何をしたらいいんだ?
english: What on earth should I do?

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: ああ、そういうことか
english: Ah, I see what you mean.

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: つまり、ヘムレンさんは一生懸命情熱を込めて切手を集めている人じゃなくて
english: In other words, Mr. Hemulen is no longer someone passionately collecting stamps...

speaker: スナフキン
japanese: 今はただ切手を持ってるだけの人になったということさ
english: Now you've become just someone who has stamps.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: そう、全く楽しくないんだよ、今は
english: Yes, it's not fun at all anymore.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: そうか、目的に向かって一生懸命やってる時は
english: I see, when you're working hard toward a goal...

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 苦しいこともあるけど本当は楽しいんだね
english: There are hard times, but it's actually fun, isn't it?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: その通りだよ、ムーミン
english: Exactly, Moomin.

speaker: スノーク
japanese: どういうわけか、急に自信がなくなってしまったのです
english: For some reason, I suddenly lost all my confidence.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 誰でもそういうことは起きるよ
english: That happens to everyone.

speaker: スノーク
japanese: パパも?
english: Even you, Papa?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: もちろん私でも
english: Of course, even me.

speaker: スノーク
japanese: でも、どうやって自信を取り戻したらいいんでしょう
english: But how can I regain my confidence?

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: それは、たぶん努力して自分で見つけるしかないでしょう
english: You'll probably just have to work hard and find it yourself.

speaker: スニフ
japanese: パパ、海岸まで来てください、船を見つけたんです
english: Papa, please come to the beach, we found a ship!

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: 壊れたボートでも流れ着いたのかい?
english: Did a broken boat wash ashore?

speaker: スニフ
japanese: いいえ、もっと立派な船です、白い帆のついた
english: No, it's a finer ship, with white sails.

speaker: ムーミンパパ
japanese: それじゃあ、早速修理に取り掛かろう
english: Well then, let's get started on repairs right away.

speaker: ムーミンママ
japanese: 本当に船が動くようになったら、どこか行きましょうね
english: If the ship really starts working, let's go somewhere.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 切手の代わりに何か他のものを集めるんです
english: Instead of stamps, you should collect something else.

speaker: ムーミン
japanese: 何でもあるでしょう、ほら、蝶々なんかどうです
english: There's all sorts of things. How about butterflies?

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: コレクションを決めたよ、ほら、植物にした、これはハマナス
english: I've decided on a collection. Look, I chose plants. This is a beach rose.

speaker: ヘムレン
japanese: 私のコレクション第一号だ
english: This is the first item in my collection.

speaker: スノーク
japanese: 空飛ぶ船の新しいアイデアがひらめいたんだ、今度こそ完成するぞ
english: I got a new idea for the flying ship. This time I'll definitely complete it!
grammar: 今度こそ (this time for sure)

speaker: ナレーター
japanese: いよいよ僕たちはみんなで仕上げた船に帆を張って、大海原へと漕ぎ出した
english: At last, we set sail on the ship we all finished together, rowing out to the open sea.

speaker: ナレーター
japanese: 次回、楽しいムーミン一家、第4話、お化け島へようこそ、お楽しみに
english: Next time on Moomin: Episode 4, Welcome to Ghost Island. Look forward to it!
